Message.Title: Surface Pro goes on sale in Hong Kong on May 17/2013....
Message.Msg: Recently, Microsoft announced that the Surface Pro would be available in countries such as Hong Kong before the end of May. Now, it appears that the Surface Pro will actually make its debut on May 17th. According to a new report, the Surface Pro will be available for purchase in Hong Kong on May 17th. This detail was uncovered via an announcement on Microsoft's official Hong Kong website. As part of the launch, there will be an event at the Windsor House. Microsoft is also offering a promotion where the first 150 customers to purchase a Surface Pro in Hong Kong will receive gifts such as a Touch Cover, Wedge Touch mouse, and Office 365 subscriptions. As for pricing, the Surface Pro will run for HK $7,088 (US $913) for the 64GB model, and HK $7,888 (US $1016) for the 128GB model. The Surface Pro is already available on the mainland of China, while countries like Korea, Malaysia, Russia, Singapore, and Thailand are set to receive the Surface Pro by the end of June. As promised, Microsoft is releasing the Surface Pro to more markets around the globe. If you are wondering why your country has yet to receive the Surface Pro, Microsoft is making sure that there are plenty of devices in place for consumers to purchase.

Message.Title: Windows Azure Public Cloud To Double Sales Each Year To 2017....

SO for 2013 they expect our Azure revenues go to $1.75 billion from $1 billion in 2012, and double each year thereafter.... AT this rate we will be leaving Amazon with a small portion of the Cloud business as last month alone we signed up 10,000 new customers worldwide. Cheers Osso

Message.Title: Why IT Is Struggling To Build Private Clouds
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "IT is under pressure to build private clouds, which means creating a data center architecture that can deliver the same kind flexible, scalable computing as public clouds from Amazon Web Services and other providers. And private clouds do so without the security and control worries that come with sending data outside a company's own walls. "However, with private clouds IT professionals face a dilemma between two competing goals: They want to build private clouds that are open to other clouds but also can run existing in-house systems and applications. Private clouds must be as open and standard as possible so, if necessary, you can shift workloads out to public clouds at times of peak demand (known as cloudbursting). Many IT pros look to OpenStack and other open source code that's based as much as possible on Web standards and nonproprietary languages, such as Python."

Message.Title: Microsoft’s Open Source Company Is a Year Old. But What Is It?
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "Last week, Microsoft Open Technologies, Inc. quietly turned one year old. The birthday passed without fanfare, but next week, Microsoft plans to host a birthday party at its Silicon Valley campus. "Microsoft Open Technologies is a bit of an odd duck: It’s an independent subsidiary set up to push open source efforts by the world’s most famous proprietary software company. When it was announced, it left more than a few people — ourselves included — scratching their heads. "After all, Microsoft had already set up another entity — an independent nonprofit organization called the Outercurve Foundation — to manage open source efforts. "The difference is that although the Outercurve Foundation is funded by Microsoft, it’s governed by its own rules. And according to the foundation’s executive director, Paula Hunter, more than half of Outercurve’s projects are led by people outside of Microsoft. "Open Technologies is run by Microsoft. So, the company gets more control — a concept that’s not exactly simpatico with the open source way — and more credit for the software that it releases." .... "To date, Open Technologies has hosted a number of projects that help people who use Azure, Microsoft’s competitor to Amazon Web Services. Azure is a way for developers and businesses to build and run all sorts of software, and Microsoft realizes that these folks rely heavily on open source technologies. "But that doesn’t mean that Microsoft is becoming an open-source company. "Phil Haack, an ex-Microsoftie who’s n[o]w a developer at open-source developer tool vendor GitHub, says the Microsoft subsidiary doesn’t mean much unless it really works to open source core Microsoft software, something that would ultimately improve them and the way they work with other software. Open Technologies will only be a success, he says, if helps Microsoft open source Windows and Office."

Topic.Title: Enterprise iPad owners are buying Surface Pro....

Message.Msg: The future is bright despite 8 being a flop....tomorrow the company goes ex dividend...below is info from Sizemor Capital But there are still times when I would kill for a return to the Start button… I've argued for months that "tech is the new tobacco." And by this I mean that big technology giants-Microsoft chief among them-are currently priced for no growth and are evolving into dividend-focused cash cows. If none of Microsoft's growth initiative amount to much-if the new Xbox fails to impress, if Windows tablets never gain much market share, in the Windows Phone remains an also-ran, etc.-then Microsoft is still attractive as a cheap dividend payer with a massive hoard of cash and stable, if gently declining, businesses in operating systems, servers, and office productivity software. And if Microsoft's work pays off and any of these new initiatives wind up being a success, then Microsoft quickly becomes the buy of the decade. Disclosures: Sizemore Capital is long MSFT.

Topic.Title: BitNami Brings Open Source Apps to Windows Azure Infrastructure Services....

Message.Msg: The BitNami app store includes a wide range of best-of-breed applications for customer relationship management (CRM), wikis, project management, portal and website development, blogging and much more. Over 60 applications and development environments are currently available for Windows Azure, including: SugarCRM, Alfresco, WordPress, Drupal, Liferay, Redmine, Joomla!, Ruby on Rails and LAMP. "We are excited about the announcement of GA for the Windows Azure Infrastructure Services offering. We have seen first hand its rapid evolution into a world-class, cost-effective infrastructure platform that every business should consider when pondering a move to the cloud," said Daniel Lopez, CEO of BitNami.

Topic.Title: Bush/Cheney & Republican Congress Grabbed Their Ankles On 9/11/2001

Message.Msg: Call it “Oval Office Couch Syndrome.” SPECIAL COVERAGE: Benghazi Attack Under Microscope By their second term “inside the bubble,” presidents have completely lost touch with reality: Aides and confidants conspire to keep the chief executive insulated from the real world — the bad news, the worse press coverage. They think it’s their job, and lounging on the Oval Office couches, they nod along with the president’s every musing. But this presidency has taken OOCS to new heights. Mr. Obama has only a few trusted aides, and occasional leaks from the West Wing show a paranoid president suspicious of nearly everyone around him. Supremely confident, convinced by the fawning minions at his feet that he is untouchable, the president dismisses all controversy as partisan attacks by an overzealous opposition. A pliant press corps of stenographers follows in lockstep. Not surprisingly, every president in the past 60 years has had a major scandal in Term 2: Dwight Eisenhower had the U-2 “incident”; Richard Nixon had Watergate; Ronald Reagan had Iran-Contra; Bill Clinton had Monica (literally); George W. Bush had Katrina (and let’s not forget those WMDs that never turned up); and now, this president has Benghazi. Make no mistake: Benghazi is a major scandal. Benghazi is a scandal before, during and after the terrorist attack that left four Americas dead, including an ambassador. For months before, there were warnings about weak security at the U.S. Consulate in Libya; no one paid attention. During the attack, when Americans were begging for help, the White House ignored their pleas, sent no help. And after? That’s when the Obama scandal falls into the predictable second-term pattern his predecessors all learned the very hard way. Faced with a crisis, the Obama White House panicked. “We can’t have a terrorist strike two months before Election Day, so … let’s not have a terrorist strike two months before Election Day.” Cue the Cover-Up. washingtontimes

Helpdesk Article Which version of Microsoft Office® does CloudOn support? CloudOn currently supports Microsoft Office® 2010. You may notice that some of the elements in the applications look different from the version on your computer. This was done to make the applications easier to use while working on the tablet and smart phone. ++++++++++++ and ++++++++++++ During the D: Dive Into Mobile conference, Windows Phone corporate vice president Terry Myerson took the stage to shoot down any rumors that Microsoft is working on a branded Surface phone. Recent reports have indicated that the company is aiming to launch its own smartphone later this year sporting the latest version of Windows Phone 8 that will be released as part of "Windows Blue". But Myerson indicated that Microsoft has no immediate plans for a branded phone unless there's something the Redmond company can specifically provide. "It would have to be something where Nokia or HTC or other primary partners were not providing the consumer experience we think was possible on our platform," he said. But current Windows Phones provide the ideal experience, he said, so there's no need for Microsoft to jump into the smartphone arena and produce its own device.

Topic.Title: Microsoft’s Open Source Company Is a Year Old. But What Is It?

Message.Msg: The ideas of 2012 do not feel the same now. There was talk of all the major internet players cooperating to build a unified web including cloud. All the big players, Microsoft, Facebook, Apple & Google all agreed that the web should move towards HTML5. That has sort of moved in a half way backwards manner. It seems everyone is mad at each other, competing like mad and some tried things and dropped html5. Facebook converted to html 5 only to hate it and it was slow and sluggish and generally not working right. They dropped it and went backwards. Everyone has seen and knows what is going on between all these companies. The main thing they do is in the cloud. Yes, Linux is supported in the cloud and Microsoft has embraced all platforms. This is not the same situation with Windows 8 Phone or Windows 8. That is a closed system. You cannot build an app in Linux and install Malware and get it on Windows Phone. Windows 8 phone support html/Java & Xaml. You can use all the programming languages like C#, etc. as the code behind. Programmers have more flexibility to write Windows 8 apps by using a language they already know as the code behind and just learn XAML for the design elements. This company of Microsoft tries to play nice with everyone even though in the real world it looks like a battle now. The open source you are referring to is for Open Source Cloud standards just as everyone at least tried for html5 though it seems like a war of everyone trying to keep to themselves to me.

Topic.Title: A growing economy is self sustaining, if Ben quit printing $4MM a day we would crash

Message.Msg: There is a recovery in the U.S. housing industry (existing homes, construction and new homes) and it is the biggest, way biggest, weight on any recovery. Ben's money printing by keeping mortgages low is helping work through this boat anchor on the rest of the economy. He's not going to change. The good news for the U.S. economy is that the rest of the world is now also printing money, even the Japanese, because of the entire global retraction (deflation). Bernanke is doing a fantastic job. He will know when to end to monetary easing and that will only happen when the housing market is back to where a smaller percentage of homeowners are under water and housing prices is higher than it still is. Knowing that is enough to plan your investments for at least one year. Gold is only going to drop further over the long run. It may have little spike here and there with some international events, but it's going to $1,000 and possibly to $800 within the next two years. Investors that watched Fox News bought into the "buy gold because there's going to be inflation" fable and worse, they missed the entire market rally and are sitting on the sidelines. Lesson: Never watch ideological "news" programs (right or left) when you are investor. Fox did a great disservice to its audience these last years and cost them a bundle. I know. My friends who drank the Fox Cool-Aid are stuck with gold and missed the market rally. Hating President Obama is emotion and emotion has no place in investing.

Topic.Title: A growing economy is self sustaining, if Ben quit printing $4MM a day we would crash

Message.Msg: Hi agolferbogie. It's not just the U.S Fed that is printing money, almost everyone is, so this bodes better for the U.S. than if Bernanke was doing it alone. Now the Japanese are doing it at a faster pace than we are. I'd never believed I'd live to see that. Whether the victory is "hollow" or not, it is a victory. My portfolio is up at the greatest point in my 30 year investing career. Investors should never buy into political ideology from the right or left. Those who made money on gold were those who bought during/immediately after the financial collapse of 2008. The gold rally ended in 2010 and it's been a slide ever since as the entire world is in a deflationary contraction. Gold is toxic at this point. I agree with you that the "party" will end at some point for equities, but I'm with Warren Buffett, it's got a long way to still go before that happens. Those who missed this rally can still get in on some of it, but there will come a point where it will end as all cycles do, but not soon. And there is no housing bubble yet. That's got another 18-24 months of sorting out still to go. So, in the meantime, here's hoping you can make some money within the economic reality of our time which is what good investors do. And I truly do feel sorry for my friends who bought into the "inflation is coming" drumbeat by Neil Cavuto and Sean Hannity and the Fox "News" programs. They bought gold and missed the rally completely all because they "hated" President Obama. I'm just an investor. I don't drag politics into my investing. Watch Bloomberg if any financial television. Otherwise, always do your own research.

Message.Title: MSFT Option Activity May 8/2013....
Message.Msg: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) was targeted by bullish option traders on Wednesday, who expect upside in the shares through the next six weeks. Demand for long calls is nothing new for the software giant; in the last 10 days, calls have been purchased to open at a pace of nearly 3-to-2 over their put counterparts. In yesterday's trading, the June 33 call was in focus. More than 17,500 contracts changed hands, almost 90% of which translated as new open interest overnight. The majority of the volume traded at the ask price and implied volatility rose by just shy of 1 percentage point. In short, it looks as though these opening call orders were initiated on the buy side. During the last two weeks, open interest at this near-the-money strike has expanded by almost 36,000 to 76,431. It is now neck-and-neck with the June 32 call strike as home to the heaviest call open interest in the back-month series. Wednesday's call buyers scooped up these positions at a volume-weighted average price (VWAP) of $0.86, meaning the breakeven price at expiration is $33.86, or the strike price plus the VWAP. This is 3.2% above the stock's current price of $32.81, and is also just south of the stock's annual high of $33.91. AND TODAY WITH OVER 2.7 MILIION OPTIONS "CONTRACTS"; NEARLY ALL CALLS.

Topic.Title: Obama says all the hoopla about Benghazi is a side show, just tell us who told Rice to lie

Message.Msg: The Justice Department secretly obtained two months of telephone records of reporters and editors for The Associated Press in what the news cooperative's top executive called a "massive and unprecedented intrusion" into how news organizations gather the news. The records obtained by the Justice Department listed incoming and outgoing calls, and the duration of each call, for the work and personal phone numbers of individual reporters, general AP office numbers in New York, Washington and Hartford, Conn., and the main number for AP reporters in the House of Representatives press gallery, according to attorneys for the AP. In all, the government seized those records for more than 20 separate telephone lines assigned to AP and its journalists in April and May of 2012. The exact number of journalists who used the phone lines during that period is unknown but more than 100 journalists work in the offices whose phone records were targeted on a wide array of stories about government and other matters. In a letter of protest sent to Attorney General Eric Holder Monday, AP President and Chief Executive Officer Gary Pruitt said the government sought and obtained information far beyond anything that could be justified by any specific investigation. He demanded the return of the phone records and the destruction of all copies. "There can be no possible justification for such an overbroad collection of the telephone communications of The Associated Press and its reporters. These records potentially reveal communications with confidential sources across all of the newsgathering activities undertaken by the AP during a two-month period, provide a road map to AP's newsgathering operations, and disclose information about AP's activities and operations that the government has no conceivable right to know," Pruitt said. The government would not say why it sought the records

Topic.Title: Obama says all the hoopla about Benghazi is a side show, just tell us who told Rice to lie

Message.Msg: White House: 'No knowledge' of DOJ look into AP records By JENNIFER EPSTEIN | 5/13/13 7:45 PM EDT The White House has "no knowledge" of the Justice Department's efforts to obtain phone records of Associated Press reporters and editors, press secretary Jay Carney said Monday. “Other than press reports, we have no knowledge of what the Justice Department is doing," he said in a statement. "We are not involved in decisions made in connection with criminal investigations, as those matters are handled independently by the Justice Department," he added. "Any questions about an ongoing criminal investigation should be directed to the Department of Justice.”

Topic.Title: Obama says all the hoopla about Benghazi is a side show, just tell us who told Rice to lie

Message.Msg: While embroiled in two major investigations related to the Benghazi attack and the IRS’ admission that it has been targeting conservatives, the Obama administration is now facing a third scandalous accusation: It reportedly spied on Associated Press reporters just months before the 2012 presidential election. The AP said the Justice Department secretly seized two months of reporters’ and editors’ telephone records without explanation in April and May 2012. In the AP’s report on the scandal, President and CEO Gary Pruitt called the Justice Department’s move “a massive and unprecedented intrusion” into how news organizations gather the news. Pruitt wrote a letter to Attorney General Eric Holder demanding the records and all copies be returned. According to the AP, “News organizations normally are notified ahead of time that the government wants phone records and enter into negotiations over the requested information. In this case, however, the government, in its letter to the AP, cited an exemption to those rules that holds that prior notification can be waived if such notice, in the exemption’s wording, might ‘pose a substantial threat to the integrity of the investigation.’” More than 100 journalists who report on government and other matters work in offices the administration targeted. While Justice Department rules call for subpoenas of news records to be approved by Holder, it’s unclear whether he ordered the action.

Message.Title: JUST OUT....IRS officials in Washington were involved in targeting of conservative groups....
Message.Msg: Internal Revenue Service officials in Washington and at least two other offices were involved with investigating conservative groups seeking tax-exempt status, making clear that the effort reached well beyond the branch in Cincinnati that was initially blamed, according to documents obtained by The Washington Post. IRS officials at the agency’s Washington headquarters sent queries to conservative groups asking about their donors and other aspects of their operations, while officials in the El Monte and Laguna Niguel offices in California sent similar questionnaires to tea-party-affiliated groups, the documents show.
